column1: Sattenapalle is a town in Guntur district of the Indian state of Andhra Pradesh. It is a municipality and the headquarters of Sattenapalle mandal under Guntur revenue division. It is also one of the main region in the district to be a part of Andhra Pradesh Capital Region.
The region is an important region of the ancient Kammanadu. This region is also part of the Palnadu region.

column1: Sattenapalle is a part of Guntur–Sattenapalle growth corridor.
The town has a total road length of 110.60 km (68.72 mi). APSRTC operates buses from Sattenapalle bus station to most of the cities and towns in the district like Guntur
column5: Piduguralla etc.. SH 2 passes through the town. Sattenapalle railway station is located on Nallapadu–Pagidipalli section of Guntur railway division.
